Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(24 comments)

Fair disclosure, I only really got through the code and to the tests. There are a lot of them that are skipped because they're not working, so I didn't spend much time there. I've skimmed the test modules that would cover the new stuff that is here, and it doesn't seem like there is much coverage yet of the new stuff being added here, but maybe that's because it's still WIP.

There is a ton of stuff going on in this patch, and it makes it hard to tell what test fallout comes from which change, so I'd definitely like to see this broken into pieces we can review each piece and make sure each is tested. As noted inline, this conflicts with this bug fix series, which does these refactors to make the flows use the action wrapper:

https://review.opendev.org/q/topic:%2522bug/1914826%2522

So we should just merge that. There are a lot of missing tests for the flows and surrounding code, and that series tackles them one at a time, adding and fixing test coverage as it goes. This patch will be a little smaller after that lands.

Otherwise my concerns with what is here are largely the same as when we saw this squashed into my set, and I've tried to elaborate on those inline. I definitely think that the unprotected use of the location metadata and the potential clash with an API user seems like a big problem, and we should have a tempest test to validate whatever mitigation scheme comes out of the review here.

My next largest concern with this is how much change it requires across all the layers, along with the tight integration this ends up building between the API and the low-level location storage. I think the amount of special casing that needs to happen at several places in the stack should be a huge red flag that using a store driver to manage staging is maybe not the best plan in general, and adding the locations like this make that even more obvious.

I also looked to see what the conflict space is between this and my current patches, and it's quite small:

https://pastebin.com/54CxF2TG

Literally just that you and I added a new method in the same place. Otherwise there's not really any conflict. I think we all agreed to see this fully parallel because there was some assertion that this work was so inextricably tied to master that doing it after my series was infeasible. From what I've seen here, I don't think that's really the case. Now that you've posted this and it's clear that there's (effectively) no conflict, any chance we could revisit seeing it proposed as a delta on top?

Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

With the exception of the big change to expand the database schema to move the storage out of the location metadata, it doesn't look like the rest of my comments were addressed or answered. Since this is still WIP and has test skips, I'm just copying my -1 up to this PS, with the assumption that the other comments will be addressed or answered going forward.

should have all Dan's concerns addressed. Sorry, most of these had the previous response as Draft. Should all reflect to the current situation in PS5.
